channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti Previously Reported Was Incorrectly Marked as ‘Fixed’ When it Was Not, 27th January
item.description:
For months there has been graffiti on the back of the street sign on Albert Road, on the approach to The Prince of Wales pub. Please remove the graffiti. It is bringing the area down even more. This was previously reported then flagged as ‘fixed’. But, it is still, so it is quite obviously not ´fixed’.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole very large, 27th January
item.description:
A large pot hole that I hit and it didn’t sound good. Could be dangerous if a motorbike user hit it in this bad weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A13, Chafford Hundred, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Upturned trollies and split rubbish bags, 27th January
item.description:
People have abandoned 2 trollies and a bag of clothes has been dumped and it is now spread all over the pavement at station end of Delafield Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Delafield Road, Charlton

item.title: Concrete fence post hanging into the road, 27th January
item.description:

item.title: Trip hazard causing a fall, injury and damaged property, 27th January
item.description:
The footpath is raised (tree roots?) which caused tripping and a fall. This resulted in cuts and bruises and broken spectacles. It seems the hazard has been uncovered as vegetation has been cut back

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover missing, danger to pedestrians., 26th January
item.description:
I found out the manhole cover missing and the hole is about 30-40 cm deep. People can easily miss that and it could cause bad falls leading to fractures or even more serious health hazards.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Ferntower Road, Highbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 26th January
item.description:
Has been here since before Christmas 2025, reporting again. Fly tipping on first floor Havil street flats. The block near Southampton way, with slope, backing onto Sedgmoor.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all over the stairs still, 26th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
